Package ui

Class PauseOverlay

java.lang.Object
ui.PauseOverlay
public class PauseOverlay extends Object
This class handles the pause overlay when the user hits the pause button during gameplay
Author:
John Botonakis

  • Constructor Details

    • PauseOverlay

      public PauseOverlay(Game game)
      Initializes the Pause Overlay by creating and loading in sprite for the menu and its buttons
      Parameters:
      game - - the game that is containing the playing class that holds this

  • Method Details

    • loadBackground

      private void loadBackground()
      Loads in a background based on the specified image name Background width, height, X-Position and Y-Position are also set here

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the buttons based on the users actions. Things such as hover and mouse click affect the button sprite state

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws everything that is intended to be visible, to the screen
      Parameters:
      g - - Graphics

    • createButtons

      public void createButtons()
      Creates the buttons for use only on the pause menu Scale, X position, Y position and offsets are set here

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e)
      Specifies behavior when the mouse is pressed signifying the start of a complete click.
      Parameters:
      e - - Mouse pressed event

    • mouseReleased

      public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e)
      Specifies behavior when the mouse button is released, signifying the end of a complete click
      Parameters:
      e - - Mouse released event

    • mouseMoved

      public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e)
      Executes a specific action based on the mouse movement In this case, changing the sprite to the "hover" sprite
      Parameters:
      e - - Mouse movement event

    • isIn

      private boolean isIn(MouseEvent e, PauseButton b)
      Checks to see if the mouse cursor is within the bounds of a menu button
      Parameters:
      e - - Mouse movement event
      b - - Button bounding box
      Returns:
      - Returns true if the mous is within the confines of the buttons bounding box
